alert.note: Alert for Black Hawk; Grundy; Hamilton; Hardin; Marshall; Poweshiek; Tama (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 06 at 11:43AM CST until January 06 at 3:00PM CST by NWS DesMoines
info.description: ...Bitter Wind Chills into Early Afternoon and Again Tonight... Bitter cold wind chills in the 20 to 30 below zero range will continue through mid afternoon across the north and northeast. While the wind will be less tonight, the actual temperature will drop into the 5 below to 20 below range with wind chill values once again the 20 to 30 below range. ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 9 AM CST FRIDAY... * WHAT...For the first Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 30 below zero. For the second Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 25 below zero. * WHERE...Parts of central and north central Iowa. * WHEN...For the first Wind Chill Advisory, until noon CST today. For the second Wind Chill Advisory, from 6 PM this evening to 9 AM CST Friday. * IMPACTS...The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. A Wind Chill Advisory means that very cold air and strong winds will combine to generate low wind chills. This will result in frost bite and lead to hypothermia if precautions are not taken. If you must venture outdoors, make sure you wear a hat and gloves.
